intro: Mentha hugueninii, commonly known as Huguenot mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that have a serrated edge. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or pink, arranged in whorls along the stem. Huguenot mint is valued for its strong minty scent and is used in both culinary and medicinal applications.
